page.title: 13 OSEA ISLAND
page.content: Osea island is situated in the Black- water estuary. It is connected to the mainland by a causeway which is under water at high tide. The island used to belong to the brewers,Charringtons,but now it belongs to Cambridge University.The University employs a Farm Manager to look after the island Out of 320 acres 200 acres are under cultivation - mostly cereal crops.The remaining 120 acres are mainly salt- marsh. Holidaymakers can rent some of the houses on the island and it was partly to make it more interesting for them that animals began to be kept. There is now a flock of about 90 sheep as well as some pigs. There are also pheasants,partridges, guinea fowl and peacocks on Osea.
